meanings.definition: A person who tolerates or allows something.
meanings.sent1: The tolerators in the group remained calm during the disagreement.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the tolerators for their patience and understanding.
meanings.sent3: The tolerators at the party were like the calm center of a storm.
meanings.sent4: She was the tolerator in the family, always mediating conflicts peacefully.
meanings.sent5: The tolerators in the community were known for their open-mindedness and empathy.

meanings.definition: Those who show tolerance or acceptance towards others.
meanings.sent1: The tolerators in the community welcomed everyone with a smile.
meanings.sent2: The group of friends were known as the tolerators, always supporting each other.
meanings.sent3: The tolerators at the office made sure everyone felt included and valued.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a tolerator of differences, embracing diversity in all forms.
meanings.sent5: The tolerators in the school stood up against bullying and discrimination.
